algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using Chebyshev distance for optimal movement between points.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the minimum time to visit a sequence of points on a 2D plane.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates the minimum time by summing the Chebyshev distances between consecutive points in the given order.
key_insights: The optimal movement strategy between two points involves maximizing diagonal moves.
The time taken between two points is determined by the maximum of the absolute differences in their x and y coordinates (Chebyshev distance).
The problem is a direct application of calculating the sum of Chebyshev distances between consecutive points.
